definition: interest (from an investment, esp. an endowment)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Original and Fruits is a mode classification of property since the ancient Roman.
sentences.chinese: 原物与孳息作为物的一种分类方式，源自古罗马时代。

sentences.english: Yields on government bonds also fell in Euroland.
sentences.chinese: 此外，欧元区政府债券孳息亦告下跌。

sentences.english: The returned illegal profits shall include the original thing and the fruits arising therefrom .
sentences.chinese: 返还的不当利益，应当包括原物和原物所生的孳息。

sentences.english: Long term yields marginally higher in the UK and Europe but little changed in the US.
sentences.chinese: 英国及欧洲长期债券孳息微升，但美国则无变动。

sentences.english: Article 235 The lien holder shall have the right to collect the fruits accrued from the retained property.
sentences.chinese: 第二百三十五条留置权人有权收取留置财产的孳息。

sentences.english: The fruits mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall first be used to pay the expenses for collecting the fruits.
sentences.chinese: 前款规定的孳息应当先充抵收取孳息的费用。

sentences.english: The fruits mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall first be used to pay the expenses for collecting the fruits.
sentences.chinese: 前款规定的孳息应当先充抵收取孳息的费用。

sentences.english: It has different legal rules of attribution between the fruits natural and the fruits civil.
sentences.chinese: 天然孳息与法定孳息有不同的归属规则。

sentences.english: It has different legal rules of attribution between the fruits natural and the fruits civil.
sentences.chinese: 天然孳息与法定孳息有不同的归属规则。

sentences.english: Article 235 A lienor has the right to obtain the fruits generated from the property under lien.
sentences.chinese: 第二百三十五条留置权人有权收取留置财产的孳息。

sentences.english: In addition, treasuries are oversold on both a daily and weekly basis.
sentences.chinese: 此外，在日线图及周线图上，国债孳息均显超卖。

definition: security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property
to lend/to put out a loan
another case (in law)/a case to treat separately
to appraise at the current rate
debt security/collateralized debt obligation (CDO), type of bond
